DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare the functional performance of individuals with transtibial amputation using two types of prosthetic foot designs: carbon fiber vs. fiberglass composite.
DOC.brief_title: Comparative Performance of Dynamic Elastic Response Feet
DOC.detailed_description: Recently, a new type of prosthetic foot has appeared on the market. This device is composed of a fiberglass composite material. Knowledge is lacking regarding the performance characteristics of this new device. Comprehensive studies are needed to form a solid basis for prosthetic prescription. The current study seeks to understand the experience of community-living, transtibial amputees using this prosthetic foot. Specifically, the biomechanical performance of this device will be compared to existing conventional DER technology in a controlled laboratory setting. The investigators hypothesize that the fiberglass composite material will provide more energy return and improved ankle kinematics performance.
DOC.criteria: Unilateral transtibial amputee Currently using a carbon fiber prosthetic (DER) foot for at least the last 6 months Stable stump volume over the past 6 months Medicare Functional Classification Level K3 or K4 Neuromuscular problems such as previous stroke or contralateral amputation Use of gait aids for ambulation Undergoing dialysis Poor prosthetic socket fit or stump problems (e.g., skin breakdown)
